sections.title: Introduction — Agents and Multimodal Models
sections.summary: High-level mention that agents can work with multimodal models and the plan to update the website's style to match the SAVA brand.
key_actions: Introduce agents' multimodal capabilities
State intention to update website style to SAVA branding

sections.title: Prepare Style Assets and Reference Images
sections.summary: Identify current colors as default Blazor styles, locate SAVA style assets in the repository, copy style file(s), and paste images/references into GitHub Copilot (Compiler) context.
key_actions: Locate style files and reference images in repository
Copy the SAVA/brand style file
Paste file and reference images into GitHub Copilot/Compiler context

sections.title: Prompt Compiler to Improve UI (Initial Run)
sections.summary: Use a prompt to ask the compiler/Copilot to analyze the provided images and improve the UI. The process is started and will take time.
key_actions: Send prompt to Compiler/Copilot to improve UI using reference images
Wait for analysis to begin

sections.title: Compiler Analyzes Codebase and Plans Changes
sections.summary: Copilot reads the codebase, identifies the Blazor front end, CSS cascade files, component files, and creates a step-by-step plan to implement style changes.
key_actions: Allow Copilot to scan files (CSS, component .razor files, store)
Let Copilot create a plan for implementing UI/style changes

sections.title: Apply CSS Edits and Handle Running Application
sections.summary: Copilot applies edits (e.g., to app.css). Because the app was running, a popup requests stopping the running application. Changes are kept and the application is restarted to view the updated styles.
key_actions: Accept changes Copilot made to app.css
Respond to popup asking to stop the running application
Restart/run the application to apply new styles
Refresh browser to view changes

sections.title: Evaluate Visual Results and Take Screenshot
sections.summary: Inspect the updated UI in the browser. Colors and contrast may be off; take a screenshot to document issues and use it as input for further improvements.
key_actions: Inspect new UI changes in browser
Refresh to see updated colors/contrast
Take a screenshot of problematic areas

sections.title: Iterative Improvement — Submit Screenshot and Request Fixes
sections.summary: Paste the screenshot and description back into Copilot/Compiler and ask it to improve the view. The compiler analyzes the image and attempts to implement UI fixes. Processes may take longer and can be broken into smaller changes.
key_actions: Paste screenshot and description into Copilot
Prompt Copilot to improve the UI based on screenshot
Optionally request smaller, incremental changes

sections.title: Inspect Specific Components (Product Page) and Verify Updates
sections.summary: Check specific pages/components (e.g., Product.razor) to see whether Copilot's changes affected them. Initially no changes are visible, then a new CSS appears that improves styling.
key_actions: Navigate to product page (Product.razor)
Refresh to check whether component updates were applied
Confirm presence of new CSS

sections.title: Final Run, UI Evaluation, and Iterative Refinement
sections.summary: Run the application again to confirm improved contrast and product cards. Test interactions like adding products to the cart. Note remaining UI issues (e.g., card appearance) and continue the iterative process by requesting further Copilot changes based on screenshots and style references.
key_actions: Run application and inspect product cards
Add sample products to cart to test UI interactions
Identify remaining UI issues (e.g., poor card design)
Request further iterative changes from Copilot using images/reference styles

main_topics: Applying brand styles to a Blazor application
Workflow: analyze codebase → plan → edit CSS → restart app → iterate
Using screenshots and reference images to drive UI improvements
Hot-reloading and verification of component changes (Product.razor, cards)
